intro: Bulbocodium persicum var. turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan bulbocodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its bulbous root system is adapted to survive in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
